options.label: Order of St. Julian of Norwich

psalterVersion.description: The Inclusive Psalter is a project of Young Peoples’ Theology.
psalterVersion.label: Psalter Version

value: Morning Prayer
Let us confess our sins to God.
value.label: Confession

value: Silence may be kept.
Minister and People

God of all mercy,
we confess that we have sinned against you,
opposing your will in our lives.
We have denied your goodness in each other,
in ourselves, and in the world you have created.
We repent of the evil that enslaves us,
    the evil we have done,
and the evil done on our behalf.
Forgive, restore, and strengthen us
through our Savior Jesus Christ,
that we may abide in your love
and serve only your will.
Almighty God have mercy on us, forgive us all our sins through the grace of Jesus Christ, strengthen us in all goodness, and by the power of the Holy Spirit keep us in eternal life.
Almighty God have mercy on you, forgive you all your sins through the grace of Jesus Christ, strengthen you in all goodness, and by the power of the Holy Spirit keep you in eternal life.
Invitatory and Psalter
All stand

value.text: O God, let our mouth proclaim your praise.
value.label: Officiant
People
value.text: And your glory all the day long.

value: Alleluia.

value.halfverse: therefore let us keep the feast,
value.verse:
Alleluia.
Christ our Passover has been sacrificed for us; *
Not with the old leaven, the leaven of malice and evil, *
value.halfverse: but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth. Alleluia.
death no longer has dominion over him.
value.verse: Christ being raised from the dead will never die again; *
The death that he died, he died to sin, once for all; *
value.halfverse: but the life he lives, he lives to God.
and alive to God in Jesus Christ our Lord. Alleluia.
value.verse: So also consider yourselves dead to sin, *

value.halfverse: the first fruits of those who have fallen asleep.
value.verse: Christ has been raised from the dead, *
For since by a man came death, *
value.halfverse: by a man has come also the resurrection of the dead.
so also in Christ shall all be made alive. Alleluia.
value.verse: For as in Adam all die, *
Come, let us sing to the Lord; *
value.halfverse: let us shout for joy to the Rock of our salvation.

value.verse: Let us come before God’s presence with thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and raise a loud shout to the Lord with psalms.
you are great above all gods.
value.verse: For you are a great God, *

value.halfverse: and the heights of the hills are yours also.
value.verse: In your hand are the caverns of the earth, *
The sea is yours, for you made it, *
value.halfverse: and your hands have molded the dry land.

value.verse: Come, let us bow down, and bend the knee, *
value.halfverse: and kneel before the Lord our Maker.

value.verse:
For you are our God,
and we are the people of your pasture and the sheep of your hand. *
value.halfverse: Oh, that today we would hearken to your voice!

value.verse: Come, let us sing to the Lord; *
value.halfverse: let us shout for joy to the Rock of our salvation.

value.verse: Let us come before God’s presence with thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and raise a loud shout to the Lord with psalms.
you are great above all gods.
value.verse: For you are a great God, *
In your hand are the caverns of the earth, *
value.halfverse: and the heights of the hills are yours also.

value.verse: The sea is yours, for you made it, *
value.halfverse: and your hands have molded the dry land.
and kneel before the Lord our Maker.
value.verse: Come, let us bow down, and bend the knee, *

For you are our God,
and we are the people of your pasture and the sheep of your hand. *
value.halfverse: Oh, that today we would hearken to your voice!

at Meribah, and on that day at Massah,
when they tempted me.
value.verse:
Let us listen today to God’s voice:
Harden not your hearts,
as your forebears did in the wilderness, *

value.halfverse: though they had seen my works.
value.verse: They put me to the test, *

value.halfverse:
“This people are wayward in their hearts;
they do not know my ways.”
value.verse: Forty years long I detested that generation and said, *

value.halfverse: “They shall not enter into my rest.”
value.verse: So I swore in my wrath, *
O God, you are my God; eagerly I seek you; *
value.halfverse:
my soul thirsts for you, my flesh faints for you,
 as in a barren and dry land where there is no water.
that I might behold your power and your glory.
value.verse: Therefore I have gazed upon you in your holy place, *

value.halfverse: my lips shall give you praise.
value.verse: For your loving-kindness is better than life itself; *

value.halfverse: and lift up my hands in your Name.
value.verse: So will I bless you as long as I live *
My soul is content, as with marrow and fatness, *
value.halfverse: and my mouth praises you with joyful lips,
and meditate on you in the night watches.
value.verse: When I remember you upon my bed, *

value.halfverse: and under the shadow of your wings I will rejoice.
value.verse: For you have been my helper, *
My soul clings to you; *
value.halfverse: your right hand holds me fast.

value.verse: May those who seek my life to destroy it *
value.halfverse: go down into the depths of the earth;

value.verse: Let them fall upon the edge of the sword, *
value.halfverse: and let them be food for jackals.

value.verse:
But the king will rejoice in God;
all those who swear by him will be glad; *
value.halfverse: for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.

value: O God, you are my God; from break of day I seek you.
Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all the peoples praise you.

value.halfverse: show us the light of his countenance and come to us.
value.verse: May God be merciful to us and bless us, *

value.halfverse: your saving health among all nations.
value.verse: Let your ways be known upon earth, *
Let the peoples praise you, O God; *
value.halfverse: let all the peoples praise you.

value.verse: Let the nations be glad and sing for joy, *
value.halfverse:
for you judge the peoples with equity
 and guide all the nations upon earth.

value.verse: Let the peoples praise you, O God; *
value.halfverse: let all the peoples praise you.

value.verse: The earth has brought forth her increase; *
value.halfverse: may God, our own God, give us his blessing.
and may all the ends of the earth stand in awe of him.
value.verse: May God give us his blessing, *

value: The Lessons
A Reading from ${longName}.

value.text: Hear what the Spirit is saying to God’s people.

value: A Reading from ${longName}.

value.text: Hear what the Spirit is saying to God’s people.
Hear what the Spirit is saying to God’s people.

value: The Sermon

value.label: The Apostles’ Creed
value:
I believe in God, the Father almighty,
	creator of heaven and earth.
I believe in Jesus Christ, God’s only son, our Lord,
	who was conceived by the Holy Spirit
	born of the Virgin Mary,
	suffered under Pontius Pilate,
	was crucified, died, and was buried; 
	he descended to the dead.
	On the third day he rose again;
	he ascended into heaven,
	he is seated at the right hand of the Father,
	and he will come again to judge the living and the dead.
I believe in the Holy Spirit,
	the holy catholic Church,
	the communion of saints,
	the forgiveness of sins,
	the resurrection of the body,
	and the life everlasting.
The Prayers

value.text: Hear our cry, O God.
value.label: Officiant
People
value.text: And listen to our prayer.

value.label: Officiant
value.text: Let us pray.

value:
Our Father, who art in heaven,
	hallowed be thy Name,
	thy kingdom come,
	thy will be done,
	on earth as it is in heaven.
Give us this day our daily bread.
And forgive us our trespasses,
	as we forgive those
	who trespass against us.
And lead us not into temptation,
	but deliver us from evil.
For thine is the kingdom,
	and the power, and the glory,
	for ever and ever.
value.label: The Lord’s Prayer
The Lord’s Prayer
value:
Our Father in heaven,
	hallowed be your Name,
	your kingdom come,
	your will be done,
	on earth as in heaven.
Give us today our daily bread.
Forgive us our sins,
	as we forgive those
	who sin against us.
Save us from the time of trial,
	and deliver us from evil.
For the kingdom, the power,
	and the glory are yours,
	now and for ever.

value.label: V.
value.text: Help us, O God our Savior;
Deliver us and forgive us our sins.
value.label: R.
V.
value.text: Look upon your congregation.
Give to your people the blessing of peace.
value.label: R.
V.
value.text: Declare your glory among the nations;
And your wonders among all peoples.
value.label: R.
V.
value.text: Do not let the oppressed be shamed and turned away;

value.label: R.
value.text: Never forget the lives of your poor.
Continue your loving-kindness to those who know you;
value.label: V.
R.
value.text: And your favor to those who are true of heart.
Satisfy us by your loving-kindness in the morning;
value.label: V.

value.text: So shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.
value.label: R.

value: Almighty God, whose most dear Son went not up to joy but first he suffered pain, and entered not into glory before he was crucified: Mercifully grant that we, walking in the way of the cross, may find it none other than the way of life and peace; through Jesus Christ our Lord.
value.label: A Collect for Fridays
A Collect for Saturdays
value: Almighty God, who after the creation of the world rested from all your works and sanctified a day of rest for all your creatures: Grant that we, putting away all earthly anxieties, may be duly prepared for the service of your sanctuary, and that our rest here upon earth may be a preparation for the eternal rest promised to your people in heaven; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

value.label: A Collect for Sundays
value: O God, you make us glad with the weekly remembrance of the glorious resurrection of your Son our Lord: Give us this day such blessing through our worship of you, that the week to come may be spent in your favor; through Jesus Christ our Lord.
The Sermon
Here may be sung a hymn or anthem.
Authorized intercessions and thanksgivings may follow.
Before the close of the Office one or both of the following may be used

Almighty God, Father of all mercies,
we your unworthy servants give you humble thanks
for all your goodness and loving-kindness
to us and to all whom you have made.
We bless you for our creation, preservation,
and all the blessings of this life;
but above all for your immeasurable love
in the redemption of the world by our Lord Jesus Christ;
for the means of grace, and for the hope of glory.

And, we pray, give us such an awareness of your mercies,
that with truly thankful hearts we may show forth your praise,
not only with our lips, but in our lives,
by giving up our selves to your service,
and by walking before you
in holiness and righteousness all our days;
through Jesus Christ our Lord,
to whom, with you and the Holy Spirit,
be honor and glory throughout all ages.
value.label: The General Thanksgiving

value: Almighty God, you have given us grace at this time with one accord to make our common supplication to you; and you have promised through your well-beloved Son that when two or three are gathered together in his Name you will be in the midst of them: Fulfill now, O Lord, our desires and petitions as may be best for us; granting us in this world knowledge of your truth, and in the age to come life everlasting.
value.label: A Prayer of St. Chrysostom

value: Then may be said

value.text: Let us bless the Lord.

value.response: Thanks be to God. Alleluia, alleluia
value.text: Let us bless the Lord. Alleluia, alleluia.

value: The Officiant may then conclude with one of the following
